state.definition: A point in declared state space X sufficient to evaluate all residuals.

state_space.definition: Set of admissible states under declared regularity and discretization assumptions.

weight.definition: Positive semidefinite operator applied to scaled residual.

coherence_functional.note: Also known as debt functional C(x)

receipt.note: Auditable record of attempt: state, metrics, decisions, actions, hashes, provenance

residual_block_summary.definition: Auditable summary of a residual block.

ledger.definition: Ordered sequence of receipts forming auditable history.
ledger.note: Hash-chained and immutable, serving as evidence for coherence verification

preconditioner.definition: Operator approximating inverse system matrix to accelerate convergence.

gate.definition: Pass/warn/fail rule (with hysteresis) producing accept/reject/abort decisions.

hard_gate.definition: Invariant that must never fail on accepted states; violation triggers rollback or abort.

soft_gate.definition: Quality threshold that triggers bounded repair via rails plus retry, not abort.
soft_gate.note: Allows reconfigurable system behavior within safety margins

rails.definition: Bounded corrective actions applied during repair.
rails.note: R1: dt deflation, R2: rollback, R3: projection to constraint manifold, R4: bounded gain adjustment

hash_chain.definition: Tamper-evident linking of receipts via cryptographic hashing.
hash_chain.note: Prevents falsification of execution traces and ensures accountability

certificate.definition: Summary of run, maxima, hashes, and pass/fail status.

bridge_cert.definition: Bridge certificate connecting physics and discrete systems; certifies that discrete residuals imply analytic bounds.
bridge_cert.note: The only architectural location where numerical analysis is permitted

transport.definition: Optional flow representation of coherence change.

reconstruction.definition: Error between predicted and observed/checked state.

contradiction.definition: Logical or empirical inconsistency detected as residual.

hysteresis.definition: Separate enter/exit thresholds to avoid chatter.

replay.definition: Re-running with same inputs/config/seed reproduces decisions and hashes.

kuramoto_order_parameter.definition: Measure of phase synchronization in oscillatory systems.

level_of_consistency.definition: Quantified measure of system coherence at a given layer.

normalization_scale.definition: Factor used to normalize residual components for fair comparison.

c1_state_legibility.statement: A system must have a well-defined state representation

c2_constraint_primacy.statement: Constraints are prior; violations must be tracked

c3_conservation_of_debt.statement: Violations propagate, accumulate, dissipate, or terminate

c5_irreversibility_of_failure.statement: Once incoherence exceeds bounds, rollback not guaranteed

drift_rule: Any divergence of this lexicon between repositories is a structural error.
